Question: You can be fined if your vehicle is on a road and not up to warrant of fitness standard.
You wish to move your vehicle out of a parking space into the traffic flow. What must you do before you move?

Answers.Answer: Flash your vehicle indicators for 1 second
Signal with your vehicle indicators for at least 3 seconds
Turn on your vehicle parking lights
Use your vehicle brake lights (stop lights)

A warrant of fitness is to show:

Answers.Answer: the year the vehicle was made
if the driver has had any crashes
how many times the vehicle has crashed
that the vehicle was roadworthy at the time of checking

Question: What does ‘the speed limit’ mean?

Answers.Answer: The slowest speed you can drive in good conditions
The fastest speed you can drive in good conditions
The average speed you can drive in good conditions
The fastest speed you can drive, except when overtaking

Question: If you are driving at night with your vehicle headlights on high beam, when MUST you dip them?

Answers.Answer: Approaching a police officer on point duty

Question: You are driving on a road with marked lanes and you are in the lane with an arrow showing a left turn only. What must you do?
When should you use the fog lights on your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: When you are in a hurry during the day
When you are coming up to an airport at night
When there is no fog but you want other drivers to see you
When you cannot see because of foggy conditions

Question: When passing a bus displaying a School sign, that has stopped to let children on or off, what should your speed be?
If anybody is hurt in a crash, the driver must tell a police officer as soon as possible but within:
Your vehicle has a current warrant of fitness but a rear red brake light (stop light) is not working. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Only use the vehicle during daylight hours
Only use the vehicle in a 50km/h speed zone

Question: What is the maximum legal speed limit for a car towing a trailer on the open road?
For what purpose can a vehicle use the flush median strip?

Answers.Answer: To move into the traffic flow

Question: What must you do if you intend to move your vehicle from the right-hand lane to the left-hand lane?

Answers.Answer: Move to the left as quickly as possible
Speed up and signal as you move to the left
Signal for at least 3 seconds before moving left
Slow down and signal as you move to the left

Question: When coming up to a Stop sign, where should you stop?

Answers.Answer: With the front wheels of your vehicle on the yellow lines
With the rear wheels of your vehicle on the yellow lines
Where you can see all vehicles coming from all directions
Where you can only see vehicles coming from your right

Question: What does this marking mean?
What must you do when you hear a siren or see red flashing lights from an ambulance or fire engine?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get out of the way
Pull over and allow it to pass

Question: When following a vehicle on a dusty metal (gravel) road, you should:

Answers.Answer: keep close to the other vehicles
drive down the centre of the road
adjust your speed to suit the conditions
pass the vehicle in front of you

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
You see a pedestrian carrying a white cane crossing the road. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Rev the engine to let them know that you are waiting
Take extra care and allow them to cross the road in their own time
Turn on the vehicle hazard lights and drive on
Speed up and pass in front of them

Question: You MUST dip the headlights on your vehicle when:

Answers.Answer: changing lanes in a one way street
changing lanes to exit the motorway

What must you do if you want to turn right at traffic signals where a green light is showing?

Answers.Answer: Push your way through the vehicles coming towards you
Give way to vehicles coming towards you
Wait until the lights change to red and then turn quickly
Turn at once as the vehicles coming towards you will be stopped

Question: What should you do when you come up to a one-lane bridge?

Answers.Answer: Sound your vehicle horn and drive slowly over the bridge
Turn your vehicle headlights on and drive quickly over the bridge
Slow down and check for any oncoming vehicles before driving on
Drive on and make sure any oncoming vehicles reverse off the bridge

Question: What does a yellow reflector (cat's eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: When coming to a pedestrian crossing without a raised traffic island, what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to pedestrians on your side of the road
Give way to pedestrians on the other side of the road
Give way to pedestrians on any part of the crossing
Drive on as pedestrians will give way to all oncoming traffic
